cluster_classes.class_label: Butterfly immature life stages (larva and pupa)
cluster_classes.class_description: Developmental life stages of butterflies before adulthood, specifically the feeding larval (caterpillar) stage and the pupal stage during which metamorphosis occurs.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Both entities are defined as developmental life stages within the butterfly life cycle.

members.entity_description: The larval life stage of a butterfly, immediately after the egg hatches, during which the organism is a caterpillar that feeds and grows on host plants before forming a pupa.
The third developmental life stage of a butterfly, in which the organism is enclosed in a chrysalis and undergoes metamorphosis from larva to adult.

remarks: Currently models two distinct immature stages (larva and pupa) in a single class; this is acceptable as a grouped immature-stage concept, but if finer granularity is later required, this class could be split into separate larval and pupal life-stage classes.

cluster_classes.class_description: The initial life stage of butterflies, during which the organism exists as an egg laid on suitable host plants.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The initial life stage of a butterfly, during which the organism exists as an egg laid by a female butterfly on suitable host plants.

members.entity_description: The initial life stage of a butterfly, during which the organism exists as an egg laid by a female butterfly on suitable host plants.

cluster_classes.class_description: The distinct developmental stages in a butterfly's life cycle (egg, larva, pupa, adult), treated as a collection of life stages.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the complete developmental process of butterflies from egg to adult, namely egg, larva, pupa, and adult

members.entity_name: stages of the butterfly's life cycle
members.entity_description: The distinct developmental phases a butterfly passes through from egg to adult.

remarks: This class intentionally represents the collection of all stages rather than a single stage; keep it distinct from the individual life-stage classes but within the same Butterfly Life Cycle Stages group.

args.new_description: The immature developmental stages of a butterfly after hatching and before adulthood, including the feeding larval (caterpillar) stage and the pupal (chrysalis) stage during which metamorphosis to the adult occurs.
args.remark: Currently models two distinct immature stages (larva and pupa) in a single class; this is acceptable as a grouped immature-stage concept, but if finer granularity is later required, this class could be split into separate larval and pupal life-stage classes.
args.justification: Harmonizes this class with the other butterfly life-stage classes by standardizing the Class_Group label and class_type_hint and clarifying that it covers both larval and pupal stages as immature stages within the same life-cycle domain.
Aligns the egg-stage class with the other butterfly life-stage classes by using a consistent, domain-level Class_Group label and class_type_hint focused on biological life stages.

args.new_description: The complete set of developmental stages in a butterfly's life cycle (egg, larva, pupa, adult), treated as a collection of related life stages.
args.remark: This class intentionally represents the collection of all stages rather than a single stage; keep it distinct from the individual life-stage classes but within the same Butterfly Life Cycle Stages group.
args.justification: Clarifies that this class is a collection covering all stages and standardizes its Class_Group with the individual butterfly life-stage classes for coherent schema connectivity.

executed_decisions.remark: Currently models two distinct immature stages (larva and pupa) in a single class; this is acceptable as a grouped immature-stage concept, but if finer granularity is later required, this class could be split into separate larval and pupal life-stage classes.

Aligns the egg-stage class with the other butterfly life-stage classes by using a consistent, domain-level Class_Group label and class_type_hint focused on biological life stages.
